description: From Latin referendarius, from Latin referendus (“to be referred”), gerundive of referre. Compare French référendaire. See refer.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) One to whose decision a cause is referred; a referee.
(historical) An officer who delivered the royal answer to petitions.
examples: In the writs of Merovingian kings , the king normally signed his name first , and his referendary followed

entries.meaning: (obsolete) An officer of state charged with the duty of procuring and dispatching diplomas and decrees.
